Package net.xqhs.flash.core.composite

Class CompositeAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xqhs.flash.core.composite.CompositeAgent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, Agent, Entity<Pylon>, RunnableEntity<Pylon>
    public class CompositeAgent
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, Agent, RunnableEntity<Pylon>
    This class implements an agent formed by shards and an event queue that allows shards to communicate among each other.

    Various agent shards -- instances of AgentShard -- can be added. Shards are identified by means of their designation. At most one shard with the same designation is allowed (i.e. at most one shard per functionality). TODO

    It is this class that handles agent events, by means of the postAgentEvent() method, which disseminates an event to all shards.

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      The implementation of ShardContainer as a proxy for CompositeAgent.

      • shardOrder

        protected java.util.ArrayList<AgentShard> shardOrder
        A List that holds the order in which shards were added, so as to signal agent events to shards in the correct order (as specified by AgentEvent.AgentSequenceType).

        It is important that this list is managed together with shards.

        protected java.util.ArrayList<Entity.EntityProxy<? extends Entity<?>>> agentContext
        The list of all contexts this agent is placed in, in the order in which they were added.

        The thread managing the agent's life-cycle (managing events).

      • agentState

        protected CompositeAgent.AgentState agentState
        The agent state. See CompositeAgent.AgentState. Access to this member should be synchronized with the lock of eventQueue.

        protected java.lang.String agentName
        The agent name, if given.

      • localLog

        protected net.xqhs.util.logging.UnitComponent localLog
        *EXPERIMENTAL*. This log is used only for important logging messages related to the agent's state. While the agent will attempt to use its set name, this may not always succeed. This log should only be used by means of the log(String, Object...) method.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CompositeAgent

        public CompositeAgent​(MultiTreeMap configuration)
        Constructor for CompositeAgent instances.

        The configuration is used to extract the name of the agent from it (as the value associated with the DeploymentConfiguration.NAME_ATTRIBUTE_NAME name).

        Although the name may be null, it is strongly recommended that the agent is given a (unique) name, even one that is automatically generated.

        Parameters:
        configuration - - the configuration, from which the name of the agent will be taken.

      • start

        public boolean start()
        Starts the life-cycle of the agent. All shards will receive an AgentEvent.AgentEventType.AGENT_START event.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        true if the event has been successfully posted. See postAgentEvent().

      • exit

        public boolean exit()
        Instructs the agent to unload all shards and exit. All shards will receive an AgentEvent.AgentEventType.AGENT_STOP event.

        No events will be successfully received after this event has been posted.

        Returns:
        true if the event has been successfully posted. See postAgentEvent().

      • stop

        public boolean stop()
        Alias for exit().
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Entity<Pylon>
        Returns:
        true if the entity was stopped without error. false otherwise.

      • toggleTransient

        public boolean toggleTransient()
                        throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Instructs the agent to switch state between STOPPED and TRANSIENT.
        Returns:
        true if the agent is now in the TRANSIENT state, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the agent was in any other state than the two.

      • eventProcessingCycle

        protected void eventProcessingCycle()
        The method handles the entire event processing cycle of the agent, from after the AgentEvent.AgentEventType.AGENT_START event to the AgentEvent.AgentEventType.AGENT_STOP event. The method should only return when the agent has completed stopping.

      • postAgentEvent

        protected boolean postAgentEvent​(AgentEvent event)
        The method should be called by an agent shard (relayed through AgentShard) to disseminate a an AgentEvent to the other shards.

        If the event has been successfully posted, the method returns true, guaranteeing that, except in the case of abnormal termination, the event will be processed eventually. Otherwise, it returns false, indicating that either the agent has not been started, or has been instructed to exit, or is in another inappropriate state.

        Parameters:
        event - the event to disseminate.
        Returns:
        true if the event has been successfully posted; false otherwise.

      • canPostEvent

        protected boolean canPostEvent​(AgentEvent event)
        Checks whether the specified event can be posted in the current agent state.

        Basically, there are two checks:

        • Any event except AgentEvent.AgentEventType.AGENT_START can be posted only in the CompositeAgent.AgentState.RUNNING state.
        • If the AgentEvent.AgentEventType.AGENT_START is posted while the agent is in the CompositeAgent.AgentState.TRANSIENT state, it needs to shard a parameter called "TO_FROM_TRANSIENT" (with any value).
        • The AgentEvent.AgentEventType.AGENT_START event can be posted while the agent is CompositeAgent.AgentState.STOPPED.
        Parameters:
        event - - the event one desires to post.
        Returns:
        true if the event could be posted at this moment; false otherwise.

      • FSMEventIn

        protected CompositeAgent.AgentState FSMEventIn​(AgentEvent.AgentEventType eventType,
                                               boolean fromToTransient,
                                               boolean createThread)
        Change the state of the agent (if it is the case) and perform other actions, before an event is added to the event queue. It is presumed that the event has already been checked with canPostEvent(AgentEvent) and that the event can indeed be posted to the queue in the current state.

        If the event was AgentEvent.AgentEventType.AGENT_START, the agent will enter CompositeAgent.AgentState.STARTING, the event queue is created and the agent thread is started. This method will complete only after the agent thread is actually started (synchronization is done through eventQueue).

        If the event was AgentEvent.AgentEventType.AGENT_STOP, the agent will enter CompositeAgent.AgentState.STOPPING.

        Parameters:
        eventType - - the type of the event.
        fromToTransient - - true if the agent should enter / exit from the CompositeAgent.AgentState.TRANSIENT state.
        createThread - - true if a thread should be created to process events in the event queue; false if this method should only return when the agent has stopped.
        Returns:
        the state the agent should enter next (the actual state change will happen in postAgentEvent(AgentEvent), together with posting the event to the queue.

      • FSMEventOut

        protected boolean FSMEventOut​(AgentEvent.AgentEventType eventType,
                              boolean toFromTransient)
        Change the state of the agent (if it is the case) and perform other actions, after an event has been processed by all shards.

        If the event was AgentEvent.AgentEventType.AGENT_START, the state will be CompositeAgent.AgentState.RUNNING.

        If the event was AgentEvent.AgentEventType.AGENT_STOP, the event queue will be consumed, the state will be CompositeAgent.AgentState.STOPPED or CompositeAgent.AgentState.TRANSIENT (depending on the event parameters), and the log and thread will exit.

        Parameters:
        eventType - - the type of the event.
        toFromTransient - - true if the agent should enter / exit from the CompositeAgent.AgentState.TRANSIENT state.
        Returns:
        true if the agent thread should exit.

      • FSMToggleTransient

        protected boolean FSMToggleTransient()
                              throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Changes the agent state between CompositeAgent.AgentState.STOPPED and CompositeAgent.AgentState.TRANSIENT. If the agent is in any other state, an exception is thrown.
        Returns:
        true if the agent is now (after the change) in the CompositeAgent.AgentState.TRANSIENT state. false if it is now in CompositeAgent.AgentState.STOPPED.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the agent is in any other state than the two above.

      • addGeneralContext

        public boolean addGeneralContext​(Entity.EntityProxy<? extends Entity<?>> context)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Creates a link from a subordinate entity to an entity containing it in some way.

        This method should only be used (as opposed to Entity.addContext(net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<P>) in the following cases:

        • when a context other than the direct parent of the entity is added; or
        • when the caller cannot know the exact type of the entity's parent; and
        • passing as argument an entity of the appropriate type is not possible.

        It is the responsibility of the called object to verify the correctness of the argument.

        The recommended implementation for this method is one that calls Entity.addContext(EntityProxy) after casting the argument to the appropriate type, optionally catching ClassCastException and returning false if such an exception occurs.

        This method should be idempotent (when called with the same argument): adding the same context multiple times (with no Entity.removeContext(net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<P>) operations in between) should have no effect.

        Specified by:
        addGeneralContext in interface Entity<Pylon>
        Parameters:
        context - - a reference to the higher-level entity.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful. false otherwise.

      • removeGeneralContext

      • addShard

        protected CompositeAgent addShard​(AgentShard shard)
        Adds a shard to the agent, which has been configured beforehand. The agent will register with the shard, as parent.

        The shard will be identified by the agent by means of its AgentShard.getShardDesignation() method. Only one instance per designation (functionality) will be allowed.

        Parameters:
        shard - - the AgentShard instance to add.
        Returns:
        the agent instance itself. This can be used to continue adding other shards.

      • removeShard

        protected AgentShard removeShard​(AgentShardDesignation designation)
        Removes an existing shard of the agent.
        Parameters:
        designation - - the designation of the shard to remove.
        Returns:
        a reference to the just-removed shard instance.

      • hasShard

        protected boolean hasShard​(AgentShardDesignation designation)
        Returns true if the agent contains said shard.
        Parameters:
        designation - - the designation of the shard to search.
        Returns:
        true if the shard exists, false otherwise.

      • getShard

        protected AgentShard getShard​(AgentShardDesignation designation)
        Retrieves a shard of the agent, by designation.

        It is strongly recommended that the reference is not kept, as the shard may be removed without notice.

        Parameters:
        designation - - the designation of the shard to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the AgentShard instance, if any. null otherwise.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Checks if the agent is currently in RUNNING state. In case shards are added during this state, they must consider that the agent is already running and no additional AgentEvent.AgentEventType.AGENT_START events will be issued.
        Specified by:
        isRunning in interface Entity<Pylon>
        Returns:
        true if the agent is currently RUNNING; false otherwise.

      • canAddShards

        public boolean canAddShards()
        Checks if the state of the agent allows adding shards. Shards should not be added in intermediary states in which the agent is starting or stopping.
        Returns:
        true if in the current state shards can be added.
